label: Cloud-Native Toolkit
name: #OFFERING-#VERSION
short_description: This Tile installs a common set of CNCF DevOps tools used by developers with Red Hat OpenShift or IBM Kubernetes managed container service

configuration.description: Flag indicating if the cluster already exists (true or false)
The type of cluster that should be created (ocp4, ocp3 or kubernetes)
The api key for IBM Cloud access
Existing resource group where the cluster will be provisioned.
The namespace that should be used in the IBM Container Registry. Create your unique Container Registry namespace
Flag indicating if the cluster is a VPC
The version of terraform that should be used

versions.long_description:
# Cloud Native Toolkit 

## Install CNCF Cloud-Native DevOps Tools 

This git repository is a derivative of the **Interation Zero** project from the **IBM Garage Cloud Native Toolkit**. 
It has been created to make the installation of the Toolkit CNCF DevOps tools very easy from IBM Cloud using either 
Private Catalog Tile or the Schematics services. The tools offer CNCF approach to CI/CD with IBM Manage clusters OpenShift and Kubernetes. 
   
You can find out more information about the toolkit and the iteration zero terraform here:
    
- [IBM Garage Cloud Native Toolkit](https://cloudnativetoolkit.dev/)
- [Toolkit Iteration Zero Terraform](https://github.com/ibm-garage-cloud/ibm-garage-iteration-zero)

The Tile will install a core set of the CNCF DevOps tools into your cluster and enable it for CI/CD Development

![CNCF DevOps Tools](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ibm-garage-cloud/ibm-garage-iteration-zero/master/docs/images/catalyst-provisioned-environment.png)

Follow the instructions below to install these common Cloud-Native tools into your manager cluster on IBM Cloud. 
This can be either OpenShift or Kubernetes
  

### Setup Private Catalog Offering

This Private Catalog Tile will install the  CNCF Cloud-Native DevOps Tools to an IBM Managed Cluster OpenShift of Kubernetes.


- Complete the variables      

    | **Variable**   | **Description**  | **eg. Value**  |
    |---|---|---|
    | `ibmcloud_api_key` | The API key from IBM Cloud Console that support service creation access writes  | `{guid API key from Console}`  |
    |  `resource_group_name` | The name of the resource group where the cluster is created  | `dev-team-one`  |
    |  `cluster_type`       |  The name of the IKS cluster |  `kubernetes` or `ocp4` |
    |  `cluster_name`       |  The name of the IKS cluster |  `dev-team-one-iks-117-vpc` |
    |  `cluster_exists`     |  Does the cluster exist already | `true`  |
    |  `vpc_cluster`        | Is the cluster created in VPC  | `true`  |

- Accept the License which is **Apache 2** license
- Click **Install**

- This will kick off the installation of the CNCF Cloud-Native DevOps tools into a development cluster using Private Catalog Tile.

- Once complete you can now start to use the development tools in your Cloud-Native project.
 
 - Read the [Developer Guide](https://cloudnativetoolkit.dev/getting-started/deploy-app) to get more information about using the Tools now they are running in your cluster
